CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 16, 1951, pg. 17 reads: "Coleman Murder Trial - James Coleman, 38, of Orphan Street, is led from the Criminal Courtroom of Judge Walter P. Smart Tuesday after pleading guilty to the fatal shooting of his mother-in-law, Mrs. Louise Eason, 65, last April 6. Coleman said the shots he fired were aimed at a neighbor, Clarence Carpenter, whom he accused of "breaking up my home."  Judge Smart charge Coleman with second degree murder and sentenced him to Western Penitentiary for 5-to-10- years. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: James Coleman being escorted by unknown man from courtroom of Judge Walter P. Smart after second degree murder conviction, Allegheny County Courthouse
